content.question: A <math alttext="2.00 kilograms " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> block is attached to a horizontal ideal spring with a spring constant <math alttext="k equals 100 newton per meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The block-spring system is set on a horizontal surface with negligible friction. A graph of the potential energy <math alttext="U" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for this system is shown. skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
